prompt:
You are provided with a list of characters, evidences and testimonies.
Characters:
Character 0
Name: Athena Cykes
Description: A new lawyer at the agency. She's been arrested as the suspect in the case.
Character 1
Name: Apollo Justice
Description: Currently working on his own. He says he wants to bring his friend's killer to justice, but I wonder if that's all.
Character 2
Name: Trucy Wright
Description: My daughter, who also happens to be an aspiring magician. I adopted her eight years ago.
Character 3
Name: Clay Terran
Description: The victim in this case. He was a HAT-2 crew member and a close friend of Apollo's.
Character 4
Name: Juniper Woods
Description: Athena's childhood friend. I defended her when she was on trial for the courtroom bombing incident.
Character 5
Name: Solomon Starbuck
Description: The defendant in this case.[1] He was a HAT-2 crew member and a mentor to the victim.
Character 6
Name: Simon Blackquill
Description: Convicted of the murder at the Space Center seven years ago. He's chasing a phantom he saw back then.
Character 7
Name: Bobby Fulbright
Description: The detective assigned to this case. He led the evacuation effort at the Space Center after the bombing incident.
Character 8
Name: Candice Arme
Description: A detective who specialized in bomb cases. Was on detail at the Space Center. One of the first to find the body.
Character 9
Name: Yuri Cosmos
Description: The director of the Space Center and one of the first people to discover the body. He seems exceedingly full of himself.
Character 10
Name: Ponco
Description: A guide robot at the Space Center. She can provide information on the Center and show people around.
Character 11
Name: Aura Blackquill
Description: A researcher who's developing robots at the Space Center. She is Prosecutor Blackquill's older sister.
Character 12
Name: Clonco
Description: One of the robots developed by Aura, who refers to him as "Hunk of Junk".
Character 13
Name: Metis Cykes
Description: Athena's mother and victim of the murder seven years ago. She was a talented psychologist like her daughter.
Character 14
Name: Pearl Fey
Description: A spirit medium in training. Her psychic powers are beyond question.
Character 15
Name: Miles Edgeworth
Description: The chief prosecutor. He's an old friend and a former prosecutor against whom I fought many courtroom battles.
Evidences:
Evidence 0
Name: Attorney's Badge
Description: It's my all-important badge. Proof of my profession.
Evidence 1
Name: Space Center Diagram
Description: A cross-section view of the main building of the Space Center and Launch Pad 1.
Evidence 2
Name: Utility Knife
Description: It has the victim's blood on it. From a set of utility tools used by Space Center techs. The murder weapon in this case. Athena also used one of these to stab the phantom's hand during the incident seven years ago.
Evidence 3
Name: Space Center Pamphlet
Description: It includes a diagram of the boarding lounge and a cross-section view of the Space Center. (3 pages.)
Evidence 4
Name: "Hope" Capsule
Description: Found in the victim's possession. It recently returned from a seven-year mission and contains asteroid samples. It was at the crime scene seven years ago. It was launched into space and only returned to Earth a few days ago.
Evidence 5
Name: HAT-1 Exhibit
Description: A newspaper clipping, a photo of the people involved with the launch, and a jacket one of them wore. A newspaper clipping, a photo of the people involved with the launch, and the jacket worn by Dr. Cykes.
Evidence 6
Name: Katana
Description: The weapon used in the murder seven years ago. It belonged to the victim. The victim's blood was found only on the blade.
Evidence 7
Name: Seven-Year-Old Video
Description: Video showing the corridor to the crime scene. Blackquill was the only one to pass through at the time of the crime.
Evidence 8
Name: Photo of the Crime
Description: Taken inadvertently. It became conclusive evidence at Simon Blackquill's trial seven years ago. The photo shows Blackquill taking the robot apart. There's a bloodstain at the end of the robot's arm.
Evidence 9
Name: Seven-Year-Old Photos
Description: Two photos of the body and crime scene. They were taken by the first person to discover the body. [caption] The victim is lying on the operating table. On the other side of the room is a workbench. The victim's clothes are drenched in blood.
Evidence 10
Name: Metis's Autopsy Report
Description: The cause of death was a stab wound to the chest. The weapon pierced the heart and so death was instantaneous.
Evidence 11
Name: Robots with a Heart
Description: It explains the recognition and communication features of the Ponco series of Robots.
Evidence 12
Name: Moon Rock Earring
Description: An earring that Dr. Cykes gave to Athena. The stone was cut from a real moon rock that was being used for research.
Evidence 13
Name: Phantom's Psych Profile
Description: The subject's emotions rarely fluctuate and he doesn't experience feelings like normal people do.
Evidence 14
Name: Terran's Autopsy Report
Description: Cause of death: Stabbing. The victim was discovered in the third-floor boarding lounge in the main building.
Evidence 15
Name: Security Camera Video
Description: Video showing the defendant and victim's escape from the corridor. The video ends immediately after this scene.
Evidence 16
Name: Launch Pad 1 Door Lock
Description: Starbuck's prints were found on this door lock. Also see photo taken after the incident. (2 pages.) The biometric door lock. Print authentication isn't required from the launch pad side. (2 pages.)
Evidence 17
Name: Aura's Statement
Description: The perp held a lighter with an Earth emblem on it in their left hand, and a knife in their right.
Evidence 18
Name: Lighter
Description: Evidence found by Detective Fulbright. It has Athena's prints on it in the victim's blood. A lighter that can transform into a handgun. It has Clay Terran's fingerprints and blood on it.
Evidence 19
Name: Emergency Ladder
Description: It was lowered to the ground from the window of the fourth-floor robotics lab. It was used to evacuate Space Center personnel.
Evidence 20
Name: Phony Phanty Bomb
Description: It was found in Boarding Lounge 1 and detonated in Courtroom No. 4. Fragments are being analyzed. (2 pages.)

Testimonies:
Testimony 0
Testimony: I went to the robotics lab at about 2 PM for my regular recharge!
Person: Ponco
Testimony 1
Testimony: Just as I was about to charge up, Athena came in and hugged Mommy Metis!
Person: Ponco
Testimony 2
Testimony: And then Mommy Metis fell down. After that, I was recharging, so I don't know anything.
Person: Ponco
Testimony 3
Testimony: Mommy Metis fell down near the round window on the workbench side of the room!
Person: Ponco
Testimony 4
Testimony: After I charged up, I was cleaning the room, and Mr. Simon came in.
Person: Ponco
Testimony 5
Testimony: And then an error occurred. There is no data after that point.
Person: Ponco

Which evidence and testimony contradict each other? You must only answer one pair. You may output an explanation, but your answer must end with a JSON format like so: {"evidence": 2, "testimony": 3}. The answer JSON should strictly be the last line, followed by nothing else.
cot:
Testimony 2 says Ponco was recharging and did not see anything after Mommy Metis fell down, indicating Ponco has no further information after the fall.

Testimony 5 then says there is an error and no data after that point, which aligns with Testimony 2 about lack of information after the fall.

However, Evidence 17 (Aura's Statement) provides detailed information about the perpetrator holding a lighter with an Earth emblem in their left hand and a knife in their right, which implies someone observed these actions.

Ponco's Testimony 2 says Ponco was recharging and didn't witness anything after Metis fell, yet Aura's Statement in Evidence 17 provides specific detail about the perpetrator's hands, which contradicts Ponco not seeing anything.

Thus, the contradiction lies between Ponco's Testimony 2 (no information after Metis fell) and Aura's Statement in Evidence 17 (specific observation about the perpetrator).

However, the prompt wants a pair of one evidence and one testimony.

Alternatively, consider the relationship between Evidence 18 (Lighter with Athena's prints and victim's blood on it) and Witness statements.

No direct contradiction there.

Another possible contradiction:

Testimony 1: Athena came in and hugged Mommy Metis just before she fell down.

Testimony 3: Mommy Metis fell down near the round window on the workbench side of the room.

But no contradiction.

Now consider Evidence 7 (Seven-Year-Old Video) shows Blackquill was the only one to pass through the corridor at the time of the crime.

Testimony 4 (Ponco): After charging up, Mr. Simon came in.

If Blackquill was only person in corridor at time, Simon couldn't be there too, so Ponco's testimony about Simon's presence might contradict the video.

Alternatively, the prompt wants one evidence and one testimony that contradict.

So let's check this pair:

Evidence 7 (Seven-Year-Old Video): Blackquill was the only one to pass through at the time of the crime.

Testimony 4 (Ponco): After I charged up, Mr. Simon came in.

If Ponco saw Simon coming in after recharge, but Video shows only Blackquill passing through at crime time, this is a contradiction, especially about presence at the crime time.

Assuming recharge is at time of crime, the contradiction stands.

Hence, Evidence 7 and Testimony 4 contradict.

Testimony 0
Testimony: Ha ha ha ha! I am the very embodiment of justice itself!
Person: Fulbright
Testimony 1
Testimony: I won't have you make me into a villain with your far-fetched arguments!
Person: Fulbright
Testimony 2
Testimony: And this bit about the escape route is only a theory -- you don't have any proof!
Person: Fulbright
Testimony 3
Testimony: What we DO have is proof that Athena Cykes is the culprit: this lighter with her prints on it!
Person: Fulbright
Testimony 4
Testimony: Three prints were on the lighter: the thumb, index, and middle fingers of a right hand!
Person: Fulbright
Testimony 5
Testimony: The prints were placed just the way they would be if someone were holding it lit.
Person: Fulbright
Testimony 6
Testimony: Ms. Blackquill was extremely crabby about having her work interrupted!
Person: Fulbright
Testimony 7
Testimony: The lab was very messy, so it was actually kind of a poor choice for the evacuation...
Person: Fulbright

Which evidence and testimony contradict each other? You must only answer one pair. You may output an explanation, but your answer must end with a JSON format like so: {"evidence": 2, "testimony": 3}. The answer JSON should strictly be the last line, followed by nothing else.
cot: Evidence 18 states that the lighter found by Detective Fulbright has Athena's prints on it in the victim's blood, and that the lighter can transform into a handgun and has the victim's fingerprints and blood on it. Testimony 4 by Fulbright states that three prints were on the lighter: the thumb, index, and middle fingers of a right hand. However, in the description of Evidence 17 (Aura's Statement), it is stated that the perpetrator held a lighter in their left hand and a knife in their right hand, indicating the lighter would have left prints of the left hand, not the right. This contradicts Testimony 4, which says the prints are from a right hand.

['Fulbright:\nI am an undercover investigator, but the phantom was coercing me!Fulbright:\nHe stole the moon rock and killed Dr. Cykes seven years ago!', "Athena:It's all coming back to me... Everything that happened the day my mother was murdered..."]
Evidence 3
Name: Space Center Pamphlet
Description: It includes a diagram of the boarding lounge and a cross-section view of the Space Center. (3 pages.)
Evidence 4

Testimonies:
Testimony 0
Testimony: I felt fear when I thought about the moon rock because it reminded me of the phantom.
Person: Fulbright
Testimony 1
Testimony: Yes, I'm very afraid of him because he took my family hostage.
Person: Fulbright
Testimony 2
Testimony: What reason would the phantom have to be afraid of the moon rock?! None at all!
Person: Fulbright
Testimony 3
Testimony: So the very fact that I'm afraid of the moon rock means I'm not him!
Person: Fulbright
Testimony 4
Testimony: In fact, I'm on the side of... JUSTICE!
Person: Fulbright

Which evidence and testimony contradict each other? You must only answer one pair. You may output an explanation, but your answer must end with a JSON format like so: {"evidence": 2, "testimony": 3}. The answer JSON should strictly be the last line, followed by nothing else.
cot:
Evidence 2 shows that Fulbright claims "the phantom was coercing me" and "He stole the moon rock and killed Dr. Cykes seven years ago!" This implies Fulbright is not the phantom but was forced to act under the phantom's duress.

Testimonies 0 through 4 are all from Fulbright. Specifically, Testimony 3 says: "So the very fact that I'm afraid of the moon rock means I'm not him!" which insists that Fulbright is not the phantom.

However, Testimony 2 says: "What reason would the phantom have to be afraid of the moon rock?! None at all!" suggesting the phantom wouldn't fear the moon rock, contradicting Fulbright's claimed fear in Testimony 0: "I felt fear when I thought about the moon rock because it reminded me of the phantom."

Thus, Fulbright's statement of fearing the moon rock (Testimony 0) conflicts with the statement that the phantom wouldn't fear the moon rock (Testimony 2), but these are both testimonies, not evidence vs testimony contradiction.

Now looking at Evidence 2 vs Testimony 4:
Evidence 2: Fulbright claims to be an undercover investigator, coerced by the phantom, therefore not the phantom.
Testimony 4: "In fact, I'm on the side of... JUSTICE!" which is a vague statement affirming loyalty, not a contradiction.

Focusing on contradiction between evidence and testimony, the best pair is:

Evidence 2: Fulbright claims the phantom coerced him and committed murder.
Testimony 2: Fulbright says the phantom wouldn't be afraid of the moon rock, while in Evidence 2 he claims the phantom killed Dr. Cykes and stole the moon rock.

But that's not a direct contradiction between evidence and testimony, more thematic.

Alternatively, looking at Evidence 18 (Lighter) and Evidence 17 (Aura's statement):

Evidence 18 says the lighter has Athena's prints on it in the victim's blood, but also has Clay Terran's fingerprints and blood.

Evidence 17 says the perp held a lighter with an Earth emblem on it in their left hand and a knife in their right.

No contradiction here either.

Another possible contradiction:

Evidence 7: Seven-year-old video shows Blackquill was the only one to pass through at the time of the murder 7 years ago.

Testimony 0-4 do not involve Blackquill. There is no testimony contradicting this.

Another approach:

Evidence 16: Launch Pad 1 Door Lock - Starbuck's prints found on door lock. No authentication needed from launch pad side.

Testimony from Starbuck might deny being near the scene, but no testimonies presented from Starbuck.

With the given data, the clearest contradiction is:

Evidence 2 (Fulbright's statement): "I am an undercover investigator, but the phantom was coercing me!"

Testimony 2: "What reason would the phantom have to be afraid of the moon rock?! None at all!"

Evidence says the phantom took moon rock; fear implied; testimony disputes phantom's fear.

Hence, the contradiction is between Evidence 2 and Testimony 2.
